message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $13,000. It's a great deal, considering its worth to you.  Let me know what you think!
I'm interested in the product, but $13,000 is a bit steep for me. I'd like to make a counteroffer of $11,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I think that's as low as I can go.
Bob, I appreciate your offer, but I can't go that low.  $12,000 is the absolute minimum I can accept. It's a fair price considering the value of the product to you.  Let's meet in the middle.
I understand that $12,000 is your minimum, but I'm still a bit hesitant. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, so I'll offer $11,500. I think this is a fair compromise.

Bob, I appreciate you trying to meet me halfway, but $11,500 is still a bit too low for me. I'm willing to come down a little, but I'm sticking to $11,800. This is a fair price considering the value of the product to you, and I'm confident you'll get good value from it. What do you say?

I understand that you're sticking to $11,800, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'll try to meet you halfway again, so I'll offer $11,600. I think this is a fair compromise, and I'm willing to make a final push to close the deal.

Bob,  I understand your budget constraints, but $11,600 is still a bit low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway once more and offer the product for $11,700. This is a fair price for both of us, and I'm confident you'll get great value from it. Let's close this deal!

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway again, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'll try to make one more push, so I'll offer $11,650. This is as low as I can go, and I'm hoping we can meet in the middle one last time.
